Best regards

Linton

Subject: Glas Italia – Table Legs from Specchio di Venere Tables

Dear Ram,

Following our discussion today regarding the Glas Italia delivery, I would like to confirm that upon opening the boxes for the three Specchio di Venere tables, from what we cab see, no table legs were included. The packaging design appears to accommodate only the glass tabletops, with no space allocated for legs.

Following our discussion today regarding the Glas Italia delivery, I would like to confirm that upon opening the boxes for the three Specchio di Venere tables, from what we cab see, no table legs were included. The packaging design appears to accommodate only the glass tabletops, with no space allocated for legs.

As these items were received in April—prior to my involvement in the project—could you kindly review the delivery documentation you signed off at the time and share the recorded quantities of boxes with all copied parties?

From my assessment of the boxes brought up from the basement, the number aligns with the packing list, suggesting that the shipment appears complete in terms of what was documented.

As referenced in my email on 9th July, the following Glas Italia boxes were brought to the Ground Floor:

Total: 12 Boxes
– 9 x Mirror Mirror (Library)
  • 2 x MIR11
  • 2 x MIR10
  • 3 x MIR09
  • 2 x MIR12
– 3 x Specchio di Venere Tables (Formal Living)

All boxes remained sealed until today, when we opened the three Specchio di Venere boxes, which contained only the glass tops.

Let’s cross-check the received items against the order and packing list. Following this, we may need to liaise with the supplier—via the logistics and IC teams—to clarify the status of the missing legs.

Thank you for your support.

Warm regards,
Linton
